Description: Typical range for polymer cleaning to avoid thermal damage; starting at 50 W for PVC's low melting point (~160°C); max safe ~150 W to prevent substrate melting. Source: IPG Photonics specs for fiber lasers in polymer applications; studies in Optics and Lasers in Engineering (2018) on PVC ablation.
Near-IR wavelength for optimal PVC absorption and minimal substrate damage
Beam spot diameter for precise PVC cleaning
Optimal repetition rate for efficient PVC removal
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled PVC ablation
Optimal scanning speed for uniform PVC removal
Recommended number of passes for complete PVC removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform PVC cleaning
